data.author: David C. Drake

changelog.release_notes: Updated for SDK 3.8 compatibility.
Improved the location-generating algorithm, improved saving/loading of player data, and added version information to the "About" text.
Added color and other SDK 3 updates, facilitated saving/loading of mission data, adjusted starting stats and settings, fixed a mission exit issue, and improved overall code efficiency.
Removed the texts promoting my PebbleQuest game.
Added ranged attacks for gun-wielding enemies, adjusted game difficulty, updated menu/narration texts, and increased overall efficiency.
Improved code efficiency, ensured the backlight stays on during active gameplay, and added text promoting my new PebbleQuest RPG.

Renamed "Controls" as "Instructions" and added information about how to end missions, modified the intro narration to include those "Instructions," adjusted the "About" narration, and updated narration transitions so that any button may be used to advance to the next screen.

Removed the "Excavate" mission type, significantly modified the way missions are handled (inc. description texts, reward calculations, success criteria, etc.), simplified narration texts in general, decreased upgrade costs, incremented the number of NPCs that may exist in memory at the same time, increased the rate of NPC appearance, slightly decreased the power and/or HP of several NPCs, and improved overall memory management and performance.

Resolved a wall shading issue, decreased wall hit points, increased player movement and shooting rates, made the "low ammo" penalty more effective, adjusted the mission reward system, and changed the graphics for the data storage device.

- Setting per-app setting to option that matches default value will link it back to default settings again

- Fixed sometimes app closing too soon when close to last app is disabled

- Added option to always parse statusbar notification

- Fixed error where notification would not be delivered quickly after another one being dismissed
- Fixed actions on pre-4.3 devices
- Crash fixes

- Added option to disable instant menu
- Improved performance
- Crash fixes

- Improved performance and reability
- Hourglass now only appears when user interaction is blocked
- Action menu now opens instantly, allowing you to pick action even before its text loads
- Phone now displays watchapp update notification, update with single tap
- Support for actions on 2.9 firmware native notifications
- Added writing replies from Pebble
- Added "Set all to X" convenience option to Pebble apps menu
- Added "Dismiss after reply" option
- Added "Custom title" option
- Added "Light timeout" option
- Added FAQ link to android app menu
- Moved shake action setting to per-app-settings and added more options (this resets it, sorry)

- Moved "No notifications with screen on" to per-app settings
- Added vibration option to watchapp
- Added "Dismiss from Pebble" tasker action
- Changed use defaults checkbox to reset to defaults button

- Added ability to reply via canned response or via voice on all apps that suport Wear voice reply
- Added ability to execute notification actions from the Pebble (buttons that appear under notification text on the phone)
- Added ability to execute Wear actions from the Pebble (buttons that would appear when swiping right from notification on Wear watch)

Unreasonably fast lap button clicks are ignored on stopwatch actions.  If there are existing lap times and the new lap time is less than a tenth of previous times, the click is ignored.
Fixing memory problem that sporadically caused crash on exit; fixing send of saved events to clean up overwriting of persistent data store.

* If available, use pressure sensor to improve altitude accuracy
* Display altitude above sea level (instead of WGS84)
* OruxMaps: option to start it when Pebble Bike starts
* Pebble: Bluetooth state
* Pebble: display phone & watch battery levels in menu

data.description:
(formerly known as Pebble Bike/Ventoo)

JayPS is a GPS sports tracker for your Pebble. It uses your phone's GPS to send speed, distance and altitude data to your Pebble.

You can automatically upload your track to Strava or Runkeeper at the end of the track.

If you got a Bluetooth LE Heart Rate Monitor (HRM) or Cycling Speed and Cadence (CSC), you can display heart rate (and zones with alarms) and cadence on your Pebble.

JayPS also has an innovative auto start feature which will auto start the bike computer on your watch when it detects you are riding a bike (it uses low battery technology, you can leave this switched on all day).



Features:
* GPS cycle computer (instant speed, average speed, distance, altitude, positive ascent, ascent rate, slope)
* If available, use pressure sensor to improve altitude accuracy (Galaxy S3+, Nexus 4+...)
* Tracks can be saved as GPX and exported to compatible services (Strava, Runkeeper...)
* Multiple units (metric, imperial, nautical, pace...)
* Bluetooth Smart (BLE) Heart Rate Monitor (classic bluetooth HRM are not supported) and Cycling Speed and Cadence (CSC)
* Watchapp in english, german, spanish and french
* Customizable screens with built-in configuration or with Canvas plugin
* OruxMaps integration
* Live Tracking: send your position every 30 seconds to the internet and receive your friends'positions

latest_release.release_notes:
WHAT'S NEW v3.0.0
 * New name for the app. Ventoo is now JayPS!

 * [Navigation] Waypoint notifications:
  + If the imported GPX contains waypoints, show a notification on Pebble when they are reached
  + [Online planner] Add Google Directions "turns" as notifications
  + Detect climbs + notifications (start/end) - Export to OruxMaps

data.title: JayPS - GPS sports tracker
